3.speaker: PANDA
3.japanese: {\an8}ペンギンさんって ふだん なにしてるの？

4.speaker: SASAKO
4.japanese: {\an8}そういえば いつもカフェにいますよね
4.english: Come to think of it, you're always at the café.

5.speaker: POLAR BEAR
5.english: Now, now. Everyone has a shady side.

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.japanese: ちょっと！ 人聞きの悪い まとめ方しないでくれる？
6.english: Hey! Don't summarize it in a way that makes me look bad!

7.speaker: PENGUIN
7.japanese: 僕だって カフェに来てる 以外のときは いろいろしてるよ
7.english: I do a lot when I'm not at the café.

9.japanese: つぶやいたり 街角にたたずんだりもするよ
9.english: tweet, and stand on street corners.

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: 暇を持てあましているんだね
10.english: Apparently you don't know what to do with your free time. I do know what to do!

11.japanese: 有意義に使ってるんだよ！
11.english: I'm using my time wisely! Heyo.

13.speaker: SASAKO
13.japanese: お疲れさま だいぶ慣れた？
13.english: Thanks for your hard work. Have you gotten used to your job?

14.speaker: MASAKI
14.english: Somewhat. Would you like a parfait? Would I?! And a coffee! Black, please!

15.speaker: MASAKI
15.english: Oh, wait. He was going to show me how to roast after this.

16.speaker: MASAKI
16.japanese: パフェは また食べに来ます
16.english: I'll be back later for the parfait.

17.speaker: MASAKI
17.japanese: 師匠 待ってください！

18.speaker: POLAR BEAR
18.japanese: キノボリさんと うまくやってるみたいだね
18.english: He seems to be doing well with Mr. Tree Kangaroo.

20.speaker: PANDA
20.japanese: いいなぁ 僕も誰かに弟子入りしたいなぁ
20.english: That must be nice. I want to be someone's apprentice, too. What brought this on? I got a little envious watching that guy.

23.japanese: キミがコーヒーのおいしさを紹介した人だよ？
23.english: You're the one who taught him how delicious coffee is.

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.japanese: それより僕でよかったら 弟子にしてあげてもいいけど？
25.english: More importantly, you can be my apprentice if you want.

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.english: That was fast. Hey, Miss Sasako, make me your apprentice. Are you okay with anyone, Panda?

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: 誰でもいいわけじゃないよ？

30.speaker: SASAKO
30.japanese: それを誰でもいいって言うよね

34.speaker: POLAR BEAR
34.japanese: どうして ペンギンさんの弟子は嫌なの？
34.english: Why don't you want to be Mr. Penguin's apprentice?

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: 待って！ そこは ほらなくていいんじゃない？
35.english: Hold up. I don't think we have to go there. Hello!

36.speaker: SASAKO
36.japanese: コアリクイさん いらっしゃい

37.speaker: PANDA
37.english: Please make me your apprentice. Huh?

38.speaker: PANDA
38.japanese: なんでもはしないけど 弟子にしてください
38.english: I won't do absolutely anything, but please make me your apprentice.

39.speaker: PENGUIN
39.japanese: なんでもしますから 弟子にしてくださいは聞いたことあるけど…
39.english: I've heard of, "I'll do anything, so please make me your apprentice," but...

40.speaker: SASAKO
40.japanese: なんでもはしないんですね…
40.english: Apparently he won't do absolutely anything...

41.speaker: ANTEATER
41.english: Sure, I'll make you my apprentice!

44.speaker: PANDA
44.japanese: 師匠！ お願いします！
44.english: Master! Please show me your ways! Here we go. This is the intimidation pose.

47.speaker: ANTEATER
47.japanese: いいよ はい 休憩

49.speaker: ANTEATER
49.japanese: よし 今からご飯にするよ
49.english: All right, we're going to eat now.

51.speaker: ANTEATER
51.japanese: 僕は１日に３万匹のアリを食べるよ
51.english: I eat 30,000 ants in a single day.

52.speaker: ANTEATER
52.japanese: さっ いっしょに食べよう！

58.speaker: PENGUIN
58.english: You dropped out way too fast. I've made up my mind!

59.speaker: PANDA
59.japanese: 僕 次にあのドアから 来た人の弟子になるよ
59.english: I'm going to be the apprentice of the next person who comes through that door.

60.speaker: PENGUIN
60.japanese: 珍しい弟子のなりかただね
60.english: That's definitely a unique way of doing it.

63.speaker: LLAMA
63.japanese: なるほど 師匠探しですか
63.english: I see. So you're looking for a master.

64.speaker: PANDA
64.japanese: 次ね 次来た人の弟子になるよ
64.english: Next. I'll be the apprentice of the next person.

65.speaker: PENGUIN
65.japanese: キミ本気で弟子になる気ある？
65.english: Do you actually intend to become an apprentice?

68.speaker: HANDA
68.japanese: え え… なに いったい？

69.speaker: HANDA
69.japanese: じゃ… じゃあ また来ます

70.speaker: SASAKO
70.japanese: お客さんを帰さないでもらえる？
70.english: Could you not chase away customers? The master I'm looking for is different.

72.speaker: POLAR BEAR
72.japanese: もしかしたら 身近なところに いるかもしれないよ
72.english: The person you're searching for might be closer than you think. Oh!

73.speaker: PANDA
73.japanese: お母さんは 師匠っていうより お母さんだなぁ
73.english: Well, my mom isn't so much a master as just a mom.

74.speaker: PANDA
74.japanese: もう こうなったら
74.english: I guess if it comes down to it,

75.speaker: PANDA
75.japanese: ペンギンさんに 嫌々 弟子入りするしかないのかな
75.english: I'll have to settle on being Mr. Penguin's apprentice.

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.japanese: お断りさせてもらって いいかな？
76.english: Would it be okay to decline that?

77.speaker: SASAKO
77.japanese: パンダくん シロクマさんはどうなの？
77.english: What about Mr. Polar Bear, Panda?

78.speaker: PENGUIN
78.japanese: そうだよ コーヒーの淹れ方とか サーフィンとか
78.english: Yeah. He could teach you how to properly prepare coffee, {\a6}Yes, yes, yes. how to surf, and other things.

80.speaker: PANDA
80.japanese: 僕の興味あることが 何一つないんだよね
80.english: None of those things interest me.

82.speaker: SASAKO
82.japanese: もしかして… 落ち込んでます？
82.english: Did that get you down? I don't want to learn or train for something.

83.speaker: PANDA
83.japanese: とにかく ダラダラと 弟子入りしたいんだよ～
83.english: I just want to lazily be an apprentice.

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.japanese: キミ 弟子入りやめたら？
84.english: Why don't you give up on being an apprentice? Ding! What is it, Polar Bear?

85.speaker: POLAR BEAR
85.japanese: パンダくん いい人がいるよ
85.english: I know of the perfect person, Panda.

88.speaker: POLAR BEAR
88.japanese: とにかく ダラダラ弟子入りできるよ
88.english: You'll be able to lazily be an apprentice.

90.speaker: PANDA
90.japanese: あの… バイトとかはしていますか？
90.english: Excuse me, do you work at all?

91.speaker: SLOTH
91.japanese: ず～っと ダラダラしてるよ～

93.speaker: PANDA
93.japanese: 師匠 弟子にしてください！
93.english: Master! Please make me your apprentice!

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.japanese: うまくやってるかなあ パンダくん
95.english: I wonder how Panda's getting along.

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.japanese: あれ？ シロクマくん カフェモカ 味変えた？
96.english: Huh? Polar Bear, did you change the flavor of the café mocha? I'm sorry! I made a mistake. What mistake?

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.japanese: どうしたの？ 笹子さん

99.speaker: POLAR BEAR
99.japanese: うん 何だろうねぇ？

100.speaker: GUY
100.japanese: すみませ～ん 注文いいですか？
100.english: Excuse me, could I place my order?

105.speaker: PANDA
105.japanese: いつまでダラダラしていればいいんですか？
105.english: How long am I supposed to laze around?

109.speaker: PANDA
109.japanese: 時間でいうと… あと どれくらい？
109.english: In terms of time, how much longer?

112.speaker: SLOTH
112.japanese: さっき～ ちょっと動いたから
112.english: I moved... a little bit earlier...

118.speaker: PANDA
118.english: On top of the tree? Yep... just like this... and there are leaves...

121.speaker: SLOTH
121.japanese: しない～ ず～っと こうしてる～
121.english: Nope... we just... stay like this forever...

123.speaker: PANDA
123.japanese: 他には？ 他には 何もしないの？
123.english: Anything else? Do we do anything else?

124.speaker: SLOTH
124.japanese: 週に１回 地上に下りるよ～
124.english: Once a week... we go on land...

126.english: We only go on land once a week?

130.speaker: SLOTH
130.japanese: あと５日くらい こうしてるよ～
130.english: So I'll be up here for about five days...

133.speaker: PANDA
133.english: You only go to the bathroom once a week, too?

134.speaker: SLOTH
134.japanese: うん あとはず～っと こうしてる
134.english: Yep. Otherwise... I'm always up here...

135.speaker: PANDA
135.english: Always? Lazing around sure is difficult...

136.speaker: PANDA
136.japanese: な… なんてすごい ナマケぶりだろう

137.speaker: PANDA
137.english: I can't copy it! He's a pro.

138.speaker: PANDA
138.english: He's a pro in laziness! So, you quit being his apprentice?

139.speaker: PANDA
139.japanese: うん ナマケのプロはあきらめたよ
139.english: Yeah. I gave up trying to be a pro in laziness.

140.speaker: PENGUIN
140.english: I see. I've made up my mind.

142.speaker: PANDA
142.japanese: 僕には師匠は必要ない

143.speaker: PANDA
143.japanese: 僕 ナマケのアマチュアでいくよ！
143.english: I'm going to be an amateur in laziness.

144.speaker: PENGUIN
144.japanese: 最高にだらしないフレーズだね
144.english: That is a ridiculously undisciplined phrase.

145.speaker: PANDA
145.japanese: 僕は僕のペースで頑張ってダラダラするよ
145.english: I'm going to be lazy at my own pace.

146.speaker: PENGUIN
146.japanese: なんて表明する必要のない決心だろう
146.english: Has there ever been more of a decision that didn't need to be declared?

147.speaker: PENGUIN
147.japanese: あれ？ これはいつものカフェモカだね
147.english: Huh? This is the usual café mocha.

149.speaker: PENGUIN
149.english: What are you talking about, Miss Sasako?

150.speaker: POLAR BEAR
150.english: Now, now. Everyone has their secrets.

151.speaker: POLAR BEAR
151.japanese: ペンギンさんみたいに

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.japanese: シロクマくん そういう言い方やめて
152.english: Could you not say it like that, Polar Bear?

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.english: Good morning! What are you doing, Mr. Polar Bear? Oh, Miss Sasako, you're late.

154.speaker: SASAKO
154.japanese: え？ 何ですか？ いったい

156.speaker: SASAKO
156.japanese: え？ 今 来たばかりなのに？

157.speaker: SASAKO
157.japanese: どうしたんですか？ いったい

160.speaker: POLAR BEAR
160.japanese: いいから いいから
160.english: Don't worry about it. Let's go.

161.speaker: SASAKO
161.japanese: それでは ただいまから 町内の運動会を開始します
161.english: And now, we will begin the neighborhood sports day.

162.speaker: SASAKO
162.japanese: あの 私が司会やるんですか？
162.english: Um... I'm going to be hosting this?

163.speaker: POLAR BEAR
163.japanese: いいから いいから

164.speaker: SASAKO
164.japanese: そうじゃなくて どうして私が運動会の司会をやるんですか？
164.english: That's not what I meant. I'm more wondering why I'm the host of a sports day.

165.speaker: POLAR BEAR
165.japanese: 今年は 僕が運営係なんだ
165.english: I was in charge of operations this year.

166.speaker: LLAMA
166.japanese: 去年は 僕がやりました

167.speaker: POLAR BEAR
167.japanese: 僕 人前でしゃべるの苦手かもしれないんだよ
167.english: I might not like speaking in front of people.

168.speaker: SASAKO
168.japanese: よくわからないですがわかりました
168.english: I don't really know what's going on, but all right. Thanks.

169.speaker: SASAKO
169.japanese: ええ それでは本年度の町内運動会を開始します
169.english: Um... we will now commence this year's neighborhood sports day.

172.speaker: GRIZZLY
172.japanese: おう シロクマ！ 今年は てめえを負かせてやるからな！
172.english: Hey, Polar Bear! You're going down this year! Get fired up, get fired up!

176.speaker: P MAMA
176.japanese: あら エゾリスママ
176.english: Oh, hello there, Mama Red Squirrel.

177.speaker: S MAMA
177.japanese: ごめんなさいね 主人の支度を 手伝ってたら遅くなっちゃって
177.english: I'm sorry, I lost track of time helping out the husband.

178.speaker: P MAMA
178.japanese: いいえ 忙しくなるわよ 今日は
178.english: No worries. It's going to be a busy day today.

179.speaker: S MAMA
179.japanese: {\fs27}ちょっと おにぎりの具 笹ばっかりじゃなくてクルミも入れてよ！
179.english: Come on now. Don't just put bamboo grass in the rice balls. Make sure you get walnuts in some, too.

180.speaker: P MAMA
180.japanese: いいわね クルミも入れましょ
180.english: Good idea. I'll add some walnuts, too.

181.speaker: S MAMA
181.japanese: 笹と一緒に入れちゃうのね…
181.english: So you're going to put it in with the bamboo grass...

182.speaker: S MAMA
182.japanese: いいのかしら こんな偏ったおにぎりで
182.english: I wonder if that's going to be okay...

183.speaker: S MAMA
183.english: Fired up, fired up! Yeah, fired up!

184.speaker: HANDA
184.japanese: 人間の参加者 僕だけなのかな
184.english: Am I the only human participant?

185.speaker: MEI MEI
185.japanese: あの… 兄がいつも お世話になってます
185.english: Um... Thank you for always looking after my brother.

186.speaker: HANDA
186.japanese: ああ パンダくんの妹さん

188.speaker: MEI MEI
188.japanese: 動物の飼育いつも応援しています
188.english: I'm always cheering for your zookeeper skills.

190.speaker: MEI MEI
190.japanese: いつもどうやって ご飯をあげてるんですか？
190.english: How exactly do you feed everyone?

191.speaker: HANDA
191.japanese: ラマさんだと こんな感じかな
191.english: Well, with Mr. Llama, something like this.

192.speaker: MEI MEI
192.japanese: キャー かっこいい！！

193.speaker: MEI MEI
193.japanese: 運動会 頑張ってください
193.english: Good luck with the sports day!

194.speaker: MEI MEI
194.japanese: キャー 恥ずかしい かっこいい！
194.english: Oh, I'm so embarrassed! So cool! Everyone participating in the first event, please gather around.

195.speaker: SASAKO
195.japanese: みんな 聞いてください！
195.english: Everyone, please listen! Oh, it's starting. Let's do our best. You're stabbing me! You're stabbing me!

196.speaker: POLAR BEAR
196.english: Oh, sorry. We will now begin the foot race.

198.speaker: HANDA
198.japanese: 僕 なんで参加してるんだっけ？

199.speaker: MEI MEI
199.english: My Prince! You can do it!

201.speaker: TORTOISE
201.english: Here we go... Here we go...

204.speaker: SASAKO
204.japanese: １位 半田さん！ ２位 レッサーパンダさん！
204.english: First place: Mr. Handa. Second place: Mr. Lesser Panda.

206.speaker: MEI MEI
206.japanese: おめでとうございます 半田さん

207.speaker: MEI MEI
207.japanese: オリンピック目指したらどうですか
207.english: Why not shoot for the Olympics?

208.speaker: HANDA
208.japanese: そんなすごくなかったでしょ

209.speaker: LESSER
209.japanese: 負けましたよ 半田さん

210.speaker: LESSER
210.japanese: これからは レッサーパンダに勝った男として
210.english: Please live the rest of your life with pride,

211.speaker: LESSER
211.japanese: プライドをもって生きていってください！
211.english: as the man who defeated  a lesser panda. Somehow, I'm not that happy.

212.speaker: S MAMA
212.japanese: パンダママったら またそんなに笹入れて！
212.english: There you go again, putting in all that bamboo grass.

213.speaker: P MAMA
213.japanese: あら エゾリスママ おいしいわよ 笹
213.english: Oh, but the bamboo grass is so delicious, Mama Red Squirrel.

214.speaker: S MAMA
214.japanese: 普通のも作りましょうよ！

215.speaker: SASAKO
215.japanese: 続きまして アザラシ食い競争です
215.english: The next event is the seal eating contest.

216.speaker: POLAR BEAR
216.japanese: 第１のコース シロクマさん

217.speaker: SASAKO
217.japanese: 第１のコース シロクマさん
217.english: In lane one is Mr. Polar Bear.

219.speaker: SASAKO
219.english: It appears that Mr. Polar Bear is the only participant.

220.speaker: PENGUIN
220.japanese: 中止だね 町内でやる競技じゃないよ
220.english: We'll have to cancel. This isn't an event to do in the neighborhood.

221.speaker: POLAR BEAR
221.japanese: やろうよ 半田さん やろう
221.english: Let's do it, Mr. Handa! Let's do it!

222.speaker: HANDA
222.japanese: 僕 アザラシ食べられないよ

225.speaker: ANTEATER
225.english: Let's have an ant eating contest!

226.speaker: ANTEATER
226.english: Ready, start! Let's see... Ants, ants, ants...

227.speaker: HANDA
227.japanese: 僕 アリも食べられないよ

228.speaker: SASAKO
228.japanese: 続きまして借り物競争です
228.english: The next event is the scavenger hunt.

229.speaker: SASAKO
229.japanese: 出場者の方は 集合してください

230.speaker: SASAKO
230.japanese: では 皆さん 準備はいいですか？

231.speaker: PENGUIN
231.japanese: ようやく 運動会らしくなってきたよ
231.english: It's finally feeling like a sports day.

232.speaker: PENKOS
232.japanese: 頑張って ペンギンさ～ん！

233.speaker: PENGUIN
233.japanese: ペ ペン子さんたち…

234.speaker: LLAMA
234.japanese: いつもはめんどくさいけど こういうときは

235.speaker: LLAMA
235.japanese: 黄色い声援もいいなあって 思ってますよね？
235.english: but at times like this, it's nice to hear their high-pitched cheering." Was that what you were thinking?

236.speaker: PENGUIN
236.japanese: 心の中のこと解説するの やめてくれる？
236.english: Could you not explain how I'm feeling?

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.japanese: え～っと どれにしようかな～ え～っと…
238.english: Let's see. Which one should I grab? Let's see...

239.speaker: GOAT
239.japanese: 上質紙は食べるには上質じゃないんだな
239.english: I guess it's not high class to eat high class paper.

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.japanese: もう！ 競技を理解してない人がいるよ
240.english: Jeez! This guy doesn't understand this event at all! All right, this one! Uh... W-What the...

242.speaker: PENKO
242.japanese: どうしたの？ ペンギンさん

255.speaker: SASAKO
255.japanese: それでは 最後の競技になりました
255.english: We will now begin our final event.

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: なんでこの組み合わせかな…
260.english: Exactly how did we get paired together?

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.english: Well, it's was the luck of the draw.

263.speaker: POLAR BEAR
263.japanese: なに？ グリズリーくん

264.speaker: GRIZZLY
264.japanese: 勝負だ！ １位は譲らねえぜ！
264.english: You're going down! I'm not giving you first place!

265.speaker: GRIZZLY
265.japanese: パンダ 死ぬ気でいくぞ！
265.english: Panda! We're gonna give it all we've got!

266.speaker: PANDA
266.japanese: うん！ 死ぬ気でのんびりいくよ
266.english: Okay. I'll give it all I got and go slowly.

267.speaker: GRIZZLY
267.japanese: のんびりするんじゃねえ！

269.speaker: PENGUIN
269.english: We're... unbalanced! Hey! What the hell are you doing?!

270.speaker: PANDA
270.japanese: グリズリーさん ひと休みしてから行こうよ～
270.english: Mr. Grizzly! Let's rest first before we go! You idiot! Hurry the hell up!

271.speaker: GRIZZLY
271.japanese: シロクマに負けちまうじゃねえか！
271.english: We're going to lose to Polar Bear! Enough!

272.speaker: SASAKO
272.japanese: １位 レッサーパンダさんとアナグマさんチーム！
272.english: First place: the Lesser Panda and Badger team!

274.speaker: LESSER
274.japanese: 勝った～！ 僕らが勝った～！
274.english: We won! We totally won! Yay! Everyone! Please give us a round of applause! {\a6}Thank you! Thank you!

279.speaker: PENGUIN
279.japanese: 徒競走… まだ 続いてたんだ…
279.english: Apparently the foot race is still going.

280.speaker: TORTOISE
280.japanese: なかなか やるね～ ナマケモノく～ん！

281.speaker: SLOTH
281.japanese: いやいや～ ゾウガメさんこそ～

283.speaker: HANDA
283.english: Thanks for all your hard work.

285.speaker: HANDA
285.japanese: 笹子さんがいちばん 疲れたんじゃないですか

287.speaker: LLAMA
287.english: Thanks for all your hard work.

288.speaker: MANDRILL
288.english: Thanks for your hard work, Miss Sasako.

289.speaker: ANTEATER
289.japanese: 笹子さん！ 司会 よかったよ
289.english: You were a great host, Miss Sasako!

290.speaker: ANTEATER
290.japanese: それで 今度 うちの弟が結婚するから
290.english: My little brother is getting married, so could you host that, too? Huh? Yep. She can.

292.speaker: PANDA
292.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

293.speaker: PENGUIN
293.english: What is it, Panda? They say it's okay to make a fool of yourself on vacation,

294.speaker: PANDA
294.english: so could you make a fool of yourself? I'd rather not.

295.speaker: PANDA
295.japanese: じゃあ 道頓堀川に飛び込んでよ
295.english: Then could you jump into the Doutonbori River?

296.speaker: PENGUIN
296.japanese: 飛び込みたくないかな
296.english: I'd rather not. You're so conservative, Mr. Penguin.

297.speaker: PENGUIN
297.japanese: 一度キミとはじっくり話したいと思ってたんだけどさぁ
297.english: I've always wanted to have a realconversation with you just once...

300.speaker: POLAR BEAR
300.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェはラジオのみでお送りします
300.english: Next week's Polar Bear's Café, will be brought to you by radio only.

301.speaker: PENGUIN
301.japanese: テレビのみでお送りします
301.english: It'll be brought to you by television only.
